`BASBL`, **B**ranch-**A**nd-**S**andwich **B**i**L**evel, is a [MINOTAUR](https://wiki.mcs.anl.gov/minotaur/index.php/MINOTAUR) solver for nonlinear bilevel problems.

----
Solving _nonlinear_ bilevel problems to global optimality is a long-standing challenge in optimization theory. 
Special cases of bilevel problems, such as problems of _linear_ (_quadratic_) â€“ _linear_ (_quadratic_) type, have been studied extensively and many algorithms have been proposed in the literature ([Dempe, 2002](http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/b101970); [Floudas and Gounaris, 2009](http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s10898-008-9332-8)). However, the general nonconvex form is very challenging and only recently the first deterministic method was proposed by ([Mitsos et al., 2008](http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s10898-007-9260-z)).

`BASBL` is based on a recent Branch-and-Sandwich algorithm (see [References](https://github.com/basblsolver/manual/wiki/References) section for the theory behind him) which guarantees to solve a broad class of bilevel problems to global optimality. Moreover, `BASBL` is enhanced with several new techniques: reduction of overhead of the UB procedure, alternative ways to calculate tighter bounds, as well as alternative choices for branching and node selection.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with `BASBL` solver? Check out our [documentation](https://github.com/basblsolver/manual/wiki).
